Tobacco craving questionnaire.Definition: a multidimensional questionnaire to assess tobacco craving.  It consists of a 47-item TCQ and other forms assessing demographics, tobacco and other drug use history, quit attempts, and current mood.  It represents four specific constructs that characterize craving for tobacco: (a) Emotionality, or smoking in anticipation of relief from withdrawal symptoms or negative mood, (b) expectancy, or anticipation of positive outcomes from smoking, (c) compulsivity, or an inability to control tobacco use, and (d) purposefulness, or intention and planning to smoke for positive outcomes.  It is an instrument for assessing tobacco craving in individuals not attempting to reduce or quit smoking.
